title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement pgovan1@aggienetwork.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: WeibullR.plotly
text: Build interactive Weibull Probability Plots WeibullR, R package Weibull analysis, plotly, interactive web-based graphing library.

title: WeibullR.plotly
text: install WeibullR.plotly R: install development version:
code: install.packages('WeibullR.plotly') devtools::install_github('paulgovan/weibullr.plotly')

title: WeibullR.plotly
text: build probability plot, first fit wblr object using WeibullR package use plotly_wblr build plot.  build contour plot, use plotly_contour function. Note contour plots available method.fit='mle' method.conf='lrb'.
code: library(WeibullR) library(WeibullR.plotly) failures<-c(30, 49, 82, 90, 96) obj<-wblr.conf(wblr.fit(wblr(failures))) plotly_wblr(obj) obj<-wblr.conf(wblr.fit(wblr(failures), method.fit = 'mle'), method.conf = 'lrb') plotly_contour(obj)

title: WeibullR.plotly
text: WeibullR.plotly several customization options.
code: plotly_wblr(obj, main='Weibull Probability Plot', xlab='Years', ylab='Failure Probability', confCol='blue', signif=4, grid=FALSE) plotly_contour(obj, main='Weibull Contour Plot', col='red', signif=4, grid=FALSE)

title: WeibullR.plotly
text: Please note WeibullR.plotly project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

title: WeibullR.plotly
text: WeibullR.learnr - interactive introduction Life Data Analysis WeibullR.shiny - shiny app Weibull Analysis

title: Reliability Growth Analysis
text: run Crow-AMSAA model, first set cumulative time failure data: run rga plot results:
code: times <- c(100, 200, 300, 400, 500) failures <- c(1, 2, 1, 3, 2) result <- rga(times, failures) plotly_rga(result)

title: Reliability Growth Analysis
text: run Piecewise NHPP, first set cumulative time/failure data specify breakpoint: run rga plot results:
code: times <- c(25, 55, 97, 146, 201, 268, 341, 423, 513, 609, 710, 820, 940, 1072, 1217) failures <- c(1, 1, 2, 4, 4, 1, 1, 2, 1, 4, 1, 1, 3, 3, 4) breaks <- 500 result <- rga(times, failures, model_type = "Piecewise NHPP", breaks = breaks) plotly_rga(result, fitCol = "blue", confCol = "blue", breakCol = "red")

title: Reliability Growth Analysis
text: run Duane Model, first set cumulative time failure data: plot results:
code: times <- c(100, 200, 300, 400, 500) failures <- c(1, 2, 1, 3, 2) fit <- duane_plot(times, failures, plot = FALSE) plotly_duane(fit, fitCol = "darkgreen")

title: Weibull Analysis
text: Next, create failure data 5 different machines fail time 30, 49, 82, 90, 96 respectively. use WeibullR package fit Weibull distribution data, plotly_wblr() function create probability plot.
code: failures <- c(30, 49, 82, 90, 96) obj <- wblr.conf(wblr.fit(wblr(failures))) plotly_wblr(obj)

title: Weibull Analysis
text: Let’s add right censored data previous example. addition 5 machines failed, add suspensions 3 machines fail (right censored) times 100, 45, 10 respectively.
code: suspensions <- c(100, 45, 10) obj <- wblr.conf(wblr.fit(wblr(failures, suspensions))) plotly_wblr(obj, suspensions, fitCol = 'blue', confCol = 'blue')

title: Weibull Analysis
text: create interval censored model, let’s use inspection data Silkworth, 2020. add suspension data units surviving last inspection date. Finally, add fit plot results.
code: inspection_data <- data.frame(left=c(0, 6.12, 19.92, 29.64, 35.4, 39.72, 45.32, 52.32),                             right=c(6.12, 19.92, 29.64, 35.4, 39.72, 45.32, 52.32, 63.48),                             qty=c(5, 16, 12, 18, 18, 2, 6, 17)) suspensions <- data.frame(time = 63.48, event = 0, qty = 73) obj <- wblr(suspensions, interval = inspection_data) obj <- wblr.fit(obj, method.fit = "mle")  obj <- wblr.conf(obj, method.conf = "fm", lty = 2) suspensions <- as.vector(suspensions$time) plotly_wblr(obj, susp = suspensions, fitCol = 'red', confCol = 'red', intCol = 'blue',              main = 'Parts Cracking Inspection Interval Analysis',              ylab =  'Cumulative % Cracked', xlab='Inspection Time')

title: Weibull Analysis
text: fit 3P Weibull, let’s create new failure data plot results.
code: failures <- c(25, 30, 42, 49, 55, 67, 73, 82, 90, 96, 101, 110, 120, 132, 145) fit <- wblr.conf(wblr.fit(wblr(failures), dist = "weibull3p")) plotly_wblr(fit, fitCol='darkgreen', confCol = 'darkgreen')

title: Weibull Analysis
text: build contour plot, let’s rerun first example use plotly_contour() function create plot.
code: failures <- c(30, 49, 82, 90, 96) obj <- wblr.conf(wblr.fit(wblr(failures), method.fit = 'mle'), method.conf = 'lrb') plotly_contour(obj, col = "blue")

title: Authors and Citation
text: Paul Govan. Author, maintainer, copyright holder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Govan P (2023). WeibullR.plotly: Interactive Weibull Probability Plots. doi:10.32614/CRAN.package.WeibullR.plotly, R package version 0.2.0, https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=WeibullR.plotly.
code: @Manual{wbllrpltl,   title = {WeibullR.plotly: Interactive Weibull Probability Plots},   author = {Paul Govan},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.2.0},   url = {https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=WeibullR.plotly},   doi = {10.32614/CRAN.package.WeibullR.plotly}, }

title: Interactive Weibull Probability Plots
text: Build interactive Weibull Probability Plots WeibullR, R package Weibull analysis, plotly, interactive web-based graphing library.

title: Interactive Weibull Probability Plots
text: install WeibullR.plotly R: install development version:
code: install.packages('WeibullR.plotly') devtools::install_github('paulgovan/weibullr.plotly')

title: Interactive Weibull Probability Plots
text: build probability plot, first fit wblr object using WeibullR package use plotly_wblr build plot.  build contour plot, use plotly_contour function. Note contour plots available method.fit='mle' method.conf='lrb'.
code: library(WeibullR) library(WeibullR.plotly) failures<-c(30, 49, 82, 90, 96) obj<-wblr.conf(wblr.fit(wblr(failures))) plotly_wblr(obj) obj<-wblr.conf(wblr.fit(wblr(failures), method.fit = 'mle'), method.conf = 'lrb') plotly_contour(obj)

title: Interactive Weibull Probability Plots
text: WeibullR.plotly several customization options.
code: plotly_wblr(obj, main='Weibull Probability Plot', xlab='Years', ylab='Failure Probability', confCol='blue', signif=4, grid=FALSE) plotly_contour(obj, main='Weibull Contour Plot', col='red', signif=4, grid=FALSE)

title: Interactive Weibull Probability Plots
text: Please note WeibullR.plotly project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

title: Interactive Weibull Probability Plots
text: WeibullR.learnr - interactive introduction Life Data Analysis WeibullR.shiny - shiny app Weibull Analysis

title: WeibullR.plotly 0.3
text: Now support Reliability Growth Analysis via plotly_duane plotly_rga functions. New vignettes Weibull Analysis Reliability Growth Analysis. minor improvements bug fixes.

title: WeibullR.plotly 0.3
text: Add unit tests Update webpage Update contact information

title: WeibullR.plotly 0.3
text: plotly_wblr now lognormal plotting canvas. plotly_wblr plotly_contour plotting options.

title: WeibullR.plotly 0.3
text: plotly_wblr longer gives warning message (issue #2).

title: WeibullR.plotly 0.3
text: plotly_wblr now different subplot options. plotly_wblr plotly_contour longer plot messages console. Updated docs.

title: WeibullR.plotly 0.3
text: plotly_wblr function. plotly_contour function.

title: Interactive Contour Plot — plotly_contour
text: function creates interactive contour plot one `wblr` objects, assumed confidence contours generated via `method.conf = 'lrb'`. function overlays contours single plot displays respective MLE point estimates.

title: Interactive Contour Plot — plotly_contour
code: plotly_contour(   wblr_obj,   main = "Contour Plot",   xlab = "Eta",   ylab = "Beta",   showGrid = TRUE,   cols = NULL,   gridCol = "lightgray",   signif = 3 )

title: Interactive Contour Plot — plotly_contour
text: wblr_obj single `wblr` object list `wblr` objects. main Main title plot. xlab X-axis label (typically Eta Sigmalog). ylab Y-axis label (typically Beta Mulog). showGrid Logical; whether show grid lines (default TRUE). cols Optional vector colors contour/estimate pair. provided, colors chosen default palette. gridCol Color grid lines (default 'lightgray'). signif Number significant digits display estimates contour coordinates.

title: Interactive Contour Plot — plotly_contour
text: `plotly` object representing interactive contour plot.

title: Interactive Duane Plot. — plotly_duane
text: function creates interactive Duane plot duane object.

title: Interactive Duane Plot. — plotly_duane
code: plotly_duane(   duane_obj,   showGrid = TRUE,   main = "Duane Plot",   xlab = "Cumulative Time",   ylab = "Cumulative MTBF",   pointCol = "black",   fitCol = "black",   gridCol = "lightgray" )

title: Interactive Duane Plot. — plotly_duane
text: duane_obj object class 'duane'. showGrid Show grid (TRUE) hide grid (FALSE). main Main title. xlab X-axis label. ylab Y-axis label. pointCol Color point values. fitCol Color model fit. gridCol Color grid.

title: Interactive Duane Plot. — plotly_duane
text: function returns value.

title: Interactive Reliability Growth Plot. — plotly_rga
text: function creates interactive reliability growth plot rga object.

title: Interactive Reliability Growth Plot. — plotly_rga
code: plotly_rga(   rga_obj,   showConf = TRUE,   showGrid = TRUE,   main = "Reliability Growth Plot",   xlab = "Cumulative Time",   ylab = "Cumulative Failures",   pointCol = "black",   fitCol = "black",   confCol = "black",   gridCol = "lightgray",   breakCol = "black" )

title: Interactive Reliability Growth Plot. — plotly_rga
text: rga_obj object class 'rga'. showConf Show confidence bounds (TRUE) (FALSE). showGrid Show grid (TRUE) hide grid (FALSE). main Main title. xlab X-axis label. ylab Y-axis label. pointCol Color point values. fitCol Color model fit. confCol Color confidence bounds. gridCol Color grid. breakCol Color breakpoints.

title: Interactive Reliability Growth Plot. — plotly_rga
text: function returns value.

title: Interactive Probability Plot. — plotly_wblr
text: function creates interactive probability plot wblr object.

title: Interactive Probability Plot. — plotly_wblr
code: plotly_wblr(   wblr_obj,   susp = NULL,   showConf = TRUE,   showSusp = TRUE,   showRes = TRUE,   showGrid = TRUE,   main = "Probability Plot",   xlab = "Time to Failure",   ylab = "Probability",   probCol = "black",   fitCol = "black",   confCol = "black",   intCol = "black",   gridCol = "lightgray",   signif = 3 )

title: Interactive Probability Plot. — plotly_wblr
text: wblr_obj object class 'wblr'. susp optional numeric vector suspension data. showConf Show confidence bounds (TRUE) (FALSE). showSusp Show suspensions plot (TRUE) (FALSE). showRes Show results table (TRUE) (FALSE). showGrid Show grid (TRUE) hide grid (FALSE). main Main title. xlab X-axis label. ylab Y-axis label. probCol Color probability values. fitCol Color model fit. confCol Color confidence bounds. intCol Color intervals interval censored models. gridCol Color grid. signif Significant digits results

title: Interactive Probability Plot. — plotly_wblr
text: function returns value.
